TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit ContentElementAutomationPeer extends System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer

Docs.summary: Exposes types to UI Automation.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Windows.ContentElement owner) cil managed

Docs.param: The that is associated with this .
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig class System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer CreatePeerForElement(class System.Windows.ContentElement element) cil managed
Public Shared Function CreatePeerForElement (element As ContentElement) As AutomationPeer

Docs.param: The that is associated with this .
Docs.summary: Creates a for the specified .
Docs.returns: The for the specified .

remarks.format:
## Remarks This <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.ContentElementAutomationPeer> remains in memory until the associated <xref:System.Windows.ContentElement> is destroyed.
The same instance of the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.ContentElementAutomationPeer> is returned from subsequent calls to this method and to calls to <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.ContentElementAutomationPeer.FromElement%2A>. The type of the peer is determined by the <xref:System.Windows.UIElement.OnCreateAutomationPeer%2A> virtual callback. If <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkContentElement> does not implement the callback, no <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.ContentElementAutomationPeer> is created and this method returns `null`.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance valuetype System.Windows.Point GetClickablePointCore() cil managed
Protected Overrides Function GetClickablePointCore () As Point

Docs.summary: Gets a that represents the clickable space that is on the that is associated with this . Called by .
Docs.returns: The point that represents the clickable space that is on the element.

remarks.format: ## Remarks For example, if the element is a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Button>, the clickable point is any point that is within the visible client area of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Button> that would result in issuing the command that the button represents, when the user clicks the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Button> by using the mouse.

Docs.returns: The string that describes the functionality of the that is associated with this .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The string that is returned generally is the same text that is provided in the tooltip for the control.

Docs.summary: Gets the for the that is targeted to the that is associated with this . Called by .
Docs.returns: The for the element that is targeted by the .

remarks.format: ## Remarks For example, if the element is a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ComboBox> control, the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetLabeledBy%2A> method could get the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer> for the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Label> that is associated with the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ComboBox>.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance string GetNameCore() cil managed
Protected Overrides Function GetNameCore () As String

Docs.summary: Gets the text label of the that is associated with this . Called by .
Docs.returns: The string that contains the label.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The name property can be thought of as the string of text that a user would use to explain which control is being referred to. It is important to have a textual representation for all controls in the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_gui](~/includes/tlasharptla-gui-md.md)] so that you can programmatically refer to the control in a localized manner.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance bool IsOffscreenCore() cil managed
Protected Overrides Function IsOffscreenCore () As Boolean

Docs.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether that is associated with this is off of the screen. Called by .
Docs.returns: if the element is not on the screen; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property does not indicate whether the element is visible. In some circumstances, an element can be on the screen but still not be visible, for example if the element is obscured by other elements. In this case the method would return `false`.
